Summary As a design and product leader with 15 years experience managing UX teams and designing user interfaces for a wide variety of web, intranet and software applications for both corporate and consumer audiences I have learnt some key principles for success: 
 
Design Strategy - UX must play a key and proactive role in providing the clarity of vision that is essential for effective and competitive product strategy and development. 
 
Flexible Process - Each project is different so it’s important to be as inventive in the design process as it is in the design output. 
 
Collaboration - Design cannot succeed in a vacuum but we must always be fostering effective, collaborative cross-functional relationships. 
 
Research & Metrics - The chances of elegant and effective design are much higher through a thoughtful consideration of a wide range of user research methodologies and product metrics than from relying on a moment of random inspiration. 
 
Coaching & Mentoring - Last but not least, creating a fun and supportive work environment is essential to developing and maintaining motivated, creative and productive design teams.
